introduction_key3: Iss course ko karne ke liye aapke paas inn concepts ki solid understanding honi chahiye:
introduction_key4:
1 - Functions
2 - Loops, If-Else Conditions, Operators, Booleans, etc.
introduction_key7: Iss image mei triangle ke andar triangle ke andar triangle haiâ€¦ Yeh ek tarah se triangles ki recursion hai. Saral shabdo mei agar aap kisi cheez ko, ussi hi cheez ke terms mei express kar sakte hai toh usse recursion kehte hai. Jaise ki yeh numbers dekho :
introduction_key10: Iss code mei twopowers function mei twopowers function ko hi call kar rahe hai. Ek tarah se yeh function apni value nikalne ke liye, khud ko hi call kar raha hai.
introduction_key11: Kyuki function khud ko hi baar baar call kar raha hai, kabhi toh function ko value return karni hogi. Isliye hum base case add karte hai. Jaise humne iss program mei likha ki agar number ki value 1 hai toh, 1 return kar do.
introduction_key12:
Toh ab program mei jab hum twopowers(5) call karte hai, toh woh 2 * twopowers(4) return kar deta hai.
Par iss expression ko calculate karne ke liye twopowers(4) ki value chahiye, isliye woh uss value ka wait karta hai.
introduction_key13:
Toh ab program mei jab hum twopowers(4) call karte hai, toh woh 2 * twopowers(3) return kar deta hai.
Par iss expression ko calculate karne ke liye twopowers(3) ki value chahiye, isliye woh uss value ka wait karta hai.
introduction_key14:
Toh ab program mei jab hum twopowers(3) call karte hai, toh woh 2 * twopowers(2) return kar deta hai.
Par iss expression ko calculate karne ke liye twopowers(2) ki value chahiye, isliye woh uss value ka wait karta hai.
introduction_key15:
Toh ab program mei jab hum twopowers(2) call karte hai, toh woh 2 * twopowers(1) return kar deta hai.
Par iss expression ko calculate karne ke liye twopowers(1) ki value chahiye, isliye woh uss value ka wait karta hai.
introduction_key16: Toh ab program mei jab hum twopowers(1) call karte hai, toh woh 1 return kar deta hai. BASE CASE CONDITION
introduction_key17: Ab kyuki twopowers(1) ki value pata hai. Toh 2 * twopowers(1) ki value calculate ho kar 2 * 1 = 2 pata chal jaati hai. Yeh twopowers(2) ki value hai.
introduction_key18: Ab kyuki twopowers(2) ki value pata hai. Toh 2 * twopowers(2) ki value calculate ho kar 2 * 2 = 4 pata chal jaati hai. Yeh twopowers(3) ki value hai.
introduction_key19: Ab kyuki twopowers(3) ki value pata hai. Toh 2 * twopowers(2) ki value calculate ho kar 2 * 4 = 8 pata chal jaati hai. Yeh twopowers(4) ki value hai.
introduction_key20: Ab kyuki twopowers(4) ki value pata hai. Toh 2 * twopowers(3) ki value calculate ho kar 2 * 8 = 16 pata chal jaati hai. Yeh twopowers(5) ki value hai.
introduction_key21: Isliye twopowers(5) ka answer 16 hai.
introduction_key22: Kya aap isi tarah sochte hue, agli exercise mei diye hue kuch patterns ka solution likh sakte hai?
